## Using References With Overleaf
VS Code is not your only option. Overleaf also use ".bib" files to hold references, though some of the other syntax is different. 

Here are some links to get you started with references in overleaf.
1. [Linking Overleaf and Zotero](https://www.overleaf.com/learn/how-to/How_to_link_your_Overleaf_account_to_Mendeley_and_Zotero)
2. [Connecting Zotero and Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/visual-editor/technical.html#citations-from-zotero\)
